00021 
00022 void gpClassifier::fSearch(bool goVerbose)
00023 {
00024 
00026     //     Linesearch Parameters     //
00028     
00029     double sigma = 0.50;
00030     double rho = 0.1;
00031     
00032     // Initial step sizes
00033     double oldSlope = 0;
00034     double delta1 = 0;
00035     double delta2 = 0;
00036     
00037     // Line search variables
00038     double f1 = 0;
00039     double f2 = 0;
00040     double dfds1 = 0;
00041     double dfds2 = 0;
00042     double d1 = 0;
00043     double d2 = 0;
00044     
00045     // Number of matrix inversions per search
00046     int nEpochs = 0;
00047     
00049     //    Initiate the conjugate gradient descent     //
00051 
00052     // Store initial point, using mHyperparameters for exploration afterwards
00053     for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i) mH1[i] = mHyperParameters[i];
00054     mH2 = mHyperParameters;
00055 
00056     // negative log evidence and negative gradient at the initial point
00057     covariance(); invert();
00058     f1 = - logEvidence();
00059     gradLogE(mG1);
00060     for(double *gradPtr = mG1; gradPtr != mG1 + mNumHyperParameters; ++gradPtr) *gradPtr *= -1;
00061     ++nEpochs;
00062 
00063     // Initial search direction follows the gradient
00064     for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i) mS[i] = - mG1[i];
00065     for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i) mGi[i] = mG1[i];
00066     
00067     // Normalize initial search direction
00068     double norm = 1 / sqrt(fDot(mS, mS));
00069     for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i)
00070     {
00071         mD[i] = mS[i] * norm;
00072     }
00073     
00074     // Initial directional derivative
00075     dfds1 = fDot(mG1, mD);
00076     
00077     // Initial step size guess
00078     oldSlope = dfds1;
00079     delta1 = 50.0 / (1 + fabs(dfds1));
00080     
00082     //     Start the conjugate gradient descent     //
00084 
00085     int nConsecutiveRestarts = 0;
00086     bool restart = 0;
00087 
00088     // Perform line searches along conjugate directions
00089     // until the search criteria have been satisfied
00090     while(1)
00091     {
00092 
00093         // Check if a restart has been requested
00094         if(restart)
00095         {
00096 
00097             if(goVerbose) cout << "\tRestarting line search..." << endl << endl;
00098 
00099             // Check that the restarted search direction points to a minimum
00100             if(nConsecutiveRestarts > 1) break;
00101 
00102             ++nConsecutiveRestarts;
00103             
00104             // Reset search direction to local gradient
00105             for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i) mS[i] = - mG1[i];
00106             for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i) mGi[i] = mG1[i];
00107             
00108             // Normalize the search direction
00109             norm = 1 / sqrt(fDot(mS, mS));
00110             for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i) mD[i] = mS[i] * norm;
00111             
00112             // Directional derivative
00113             dfds1 = fDot(mG1, mD);
00114             
00115             // Check that the restarted search direction points to a minimum
00116             if(dfds1 > 0) break;
00117 
00118             // New initial step size guess
00119             delta1 = 50.0 / (1 + fabs(dfds1));
00120             
00121             // Reset restart flag
00122             restart = 0;
00123             
00124         }  
00125         else
00126         {
00127             if(goVerbose) cout << "\tBeginning line search along new conjugate gradient direction with " << endl;
00128             if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\tf1 = " << f1 << ", dfds1 = " << dfds1 << endl << endl;
00129         }
00130         
00131         
00132         // Restart if the initial slope is positive
00133         if(dfds1 > 0) 
00134         {
00135             restart = 1;
00136             continue;
00137         }   
00138         
00139         if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\tComputing initial guess..." << endl;
00140 
00141         // Initial guess
00142         for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i) mH2[i] = mH1[i] + delta1 * mD[i];
00143         
00144         // Evaluate the minus log evidence
00145         // and minus gradient at this guess
00146         covariance(); invert();
00147         f2 = - logEvidence();
00148         gradLogE(mG2);
00149         for(double *gradPtr = mG2; gradPtr != mG2 + mNumHyperParameters; ++gradPtr) *gradPtr *= -1;
00150         ++nEpochs;
00151         
00152         // Calculate the directional derivative at the guess
00153         dfds2 = fDot(mG2, mD);                    
00154 
00155         if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\t\tf2 = " << f2 << ", dfds2 = " << dfds2 << endl << endl;
00156         
00158         //             Start the line search            //
00160 
00161         while(1)
00162         {
00163 
00164             // Break out of any bad loops
00165             if(nEpochs > mMaxEpochs) break;
00166 
00167             // Calculate the distances of the inital point and 
00168             // the guess projected along the line search
00169             d1 = fDot(mH1, mD);
00170             d2 = fDot(mH2, mD);
00171 
00172             // If the directional derivative at the guess is too
00173             // large then the guess has overshot the minimum and
00174             // an interpolation is necessary 
00175             bool a2 = dfds2 > - sigma * dfds1;
00176 
00177             // If the function has not sufficiently decreasaed
00178             // in value at the guess then we've passed the
00179             // minimum and an interpolation is necessary 
00180             bool b = f2 > f1 + rho * (d2 - d1) * dfds1;
00181             
00182             // Check if an interpolation is necessasry
00183             while(a2 || b)
00184             {
00185                 
00186                 if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\tInterpolating..." << endl;
00187 
00188                 // fInterpolate between the the points
00189                 double min = fInterpolate(d1, d2, f1, f2, dfds1, dfds2);
00190 
00191                 if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\t\tf1 = " <<  f1 << ", f2 = " << f2 << endl;
00192                 if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\t\tdfds1 = " << dfds1 << ", dfds2 = " << dfds2 << endl;
00193                 if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\t\td1 = " << d1 << ", d2 = " << d2 << ", interpolation = " << min << endl;
00194 
00195                 // Calculate the new point's location
00196                 // in the full feature space
00197                 for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i)
00198                 {
00199                     mH2[i] = mH1[i] + (min - d1) * mD[i];
00200                 }
00201                 
00202                 // Else go ahead and evaluate all of the
00203                 // relevant functions at this new point
00204                 covariance(); invert();
00205                 f2 = - logEvidence();
00206                 gradLogE(mG2);
00207                 for(double *gradPtr = mG2; gradPtr != mG2 + mNumHyperParameters; ++gradPtr) *gradPtr *= -1;
00208                 ++nEpochs;
00209 
00210                 // Project distance and gradient along the line search
00211                 d2 = fDot(mH2, mD);
00212                 dfds2 = fDot(mG2, mD);
00213 
00214                 if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\t\tf2 = " << f2 << ", dfds2 = " << dfds2 << endl << endl;                
00215                 
00216                 // Recheck the interpolation conditions at the new guess
00217                 a2 = dfds2 > - sigma * dfds1;
00218                 b = f2 > f1 + rho * (d2 - d1) * dfds1;
00219                 
00220             }
00221             
00222             // If the directional derivative at the new guess
00223             // is too negative then an extrapolation is necessary 
00224             bool a1 = dfds2 < sigma * dfds1;
00225             
00226             // If the directional derivative is sufficiently close
00227             // to zero then the line search has finished successfully
00228             if(!a1) break;
00229 
00230             if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\tExtrapolating..." << endl;
00231 
00232             // Otherwise, go on and fExtrapolate
00233             double min = fExtrapolate(d1, d2, f1, f2, dfds1, dfds2);
00234 
00235             if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\t\tf1 = " <<  f1 << ", f2 = " << f2 << endl;
00236             if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\t\tdfds1 = " << dfds1 << ", dfds2 = " << dfds2 << endl;
00237             if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\t\td1 = " << d1 << ", d2 = " << d2 << ", extrapolation = " << min << endl;
00238 
00239             // Shift the search window over to the new points
00240             // First with by moving the initial point over to our first guess
00241             d1 = d2;
00242             f1 = f2;
00243             dfds1 = dfds2;
00244             double hTemp = 0;
00245             for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i)
00246             {
00247                 hTemp = mH2[i];
00248                 mH2[i] = hTemp + (min - d1) * mD[i];
00249                 mH1[i] = hTemp;
00250                 mG1[i] = mG2[i];
00251             }
00252                         
00253             // And then using the extrapolation as our new guess
00254             d2 = fDot(mH2, mD);
00255 
00256             if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\t\td1 = " << d1 << ", d2 = " << d2  << endl;
00257             
00258             // Else go ahead and evaluate all of the
00259             // relevant functions at this new point
00260             covariance(); invert();
00261             f2 = - logEvidence();
00262             gradLogE(mG2);
00263             for(double *gradPtr = mG2; gradPtr != mG2 + mNumHyperParameters; ++gradPtr) *gradPtr *= -1;
00264             ++nEpochs;
00265 
00266             dfds2 = fDot(mG2, mD);
00267 
00268             if(goVerbose) cout << "\t\t\tf2 = " << f2 << ", dfds2 = " << dfds2 << endl << endl;
00269             
00270             // Return to the top of the loop to check that
00271             // the extrapolation did not go too far (else fInterpolate again)
00272             // but that it went far enough (else fExtrapolate again)
00273             
00274         }
00275 
00276         if(restart) continue;
00277         nConsecutiveRestarts = 0;
00278         
00279         if(nEpochs > mMaxEpochs) break;
00280         
00281         // If the gradient at the new point is sufficiently
00282         // small then end the conjugate gradient search.
00283         // Continuing with G2 = 0 will just result in another
00284         // line search along the same direction, while 
00285         // restarting will lead to a poor search direction
00286         //if(sqrt(fDot(mG2, mG2)) < 0.01) break;
00287         if(sqrt(fDot(mG2, mG2)) / (double)mNumHyperParameters < 4) break;
00288         
00289         if(goVerbose) 
00290         {
00291             cout << "\t\tLine search complete, <mG2_{i}> = " 
00292                  << sqrt(fDot(mG2, mG2)) / (double)mNumHyperParameters << endl << endl;
00293         }
00294 
00295         // Calculate new search direction
00296         // using the Polak-Ribiere approximation
00297         double numer = 0;
00298         double denom = 0;
00299         
00300         for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i)
00301         {
00302             numer += (mG2[i] - mGi[i]) * mGi[i];
00303             denom += mGi[i] * mGi[i];
00304         }
00305 
00306         for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i)
00307         {
00308             mS[i] = - mG2[i] + mS[i] * numer / denom;
00309         }
00310         
00311         // Normalize new search direction
00312         
00313         double norm = 1 / sqrt(fDot(mS, mS));
00314         for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i) mD[i] = mS[i] * norm;
00315         
00316         // Calculate the new directional derivative and initial guess
00317         dfds2 = fDot(mG2, mD);
00318         
00319         double alpha = fabs(oldSlope / dfds2);
00320         if(alpha < 100)
00321         {
00322             delta2 = alpha * delta1;
00323         }
00324         else
00325         {
00326             delta2 = 100 * delta1;
00327         }
00328         oldSlope = dfds2;
00329         
00330         // Set current minimum to the inital point of the next iteration
00331         for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i)
00332         {
00333             mH1[i] = mH2[i];
00334             mG1[i] = mG2[i];
00335             mGi[i] = mG2[i];
00336         }
00337         f1 = f2;
00338         dfds1 = dfds2;
00339         delta1 = delta2;
00340         
00341     }
00342     
00343     // Final point
00344     for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i) mH2[i] = mH1[i];
00345     
00346     return;
00347 
00348 }

00354 
00355 double gpClassifier::fDot(double* g, double* s)
00356 {
00357 
00358     double f = 0;
00359     
00360     double *gPtr = g;
00361     double *sPtr = s;
00362     for(int i = 0; i < mNumHyperParameters; ++i)
00363     {
00364         f += (*gPtr) * (*sPtr);
00365         ++gPtr;
00366         ++sPtr;
00367     }
00368     
00369     return f;
00370     
00371 }

00385 
00386 double gpClassifier::fInterpolate(double d1, double d2, double f1, double f2, double dfds1, double dfds2)
00387 {
00388 
00389     
00390     double dd = d2 - d1;
00391     double df = f2 - f1;
00392     double ddf = dfds2 - dfds1;
00393     double dmin = 0;
00394 
00395     dmin = (0.5 * ddf * (d1 + d2) - df) / ddf;
00396 
00397     if(dmin - d1 < dd * 0.1)
00398     {
00399         dmin = d1 + dd * 0.1;
00400     }
00401     
00402     if(dmin > d2)
00403     {
00404         dmin = d2 - dd * 0.1;
00405     }
00406     
00407     return dmin;
00408 
00409 }

00424 
00425 double gpClassifier::fExtrapolate(double d1, double d2, double f1, double f2, double dfds1, double dfds2)
00426 {
00427 
00428     double dd = d2 - d1;
00429     double df = f2 - f1;
00430     double ddf = dfds2 - dfds1;
00431     double dmin = 0;
00432 
00433     // We want to use as much information as possible from
00434     // the two points, while ensuring that the resulting
00435     // quadratic opens upwards to ensure a proper extrapolation
00436     
00437     // Try using the slopes at each point 
00438     if(ddf > 0) 
00439     {
00440         dmin = (0.5 * ddf * (d1 + d2) - df) / ddf;
00441     }
00442     // Otherwise use the slope only at the initial point
00443     else
00444     {
00445     
00446         double a = df - dfds1 * dd;
00447         double b = df / (dd * dfds1);
00448         
00449         if(a > 0)
00450         {
00451             dmin = d1 + 0.5 * dd / (1.0 + b);
00452         }
00453         // Otherwise resort to a linear extrapolation
00454         else
00455         {
00456             a = d1 + f1 / fabs(dfds1);
00457             b = d2 + f2 / fabs(dfds2);
00458             dmin = (a < b) ? a : b;            
00459         }
00460         
00461     }
00462     
00463     // Ensure an extrapolation
00464     if(dmin < d2) dmin = d2;
00465     
00466     return dmin;
00467         
00468 }
